article:
Survivor Series: WarGames (2022)

Survivor Series: WarGames was a professional wrestling pay-per-view (PPV) and livestreaming event produced by WWE. It took place on November 26, 2022, at the TD Garden in Boston, Massachusetts. The event was the 36th annual Survivor Series event and the first to feature the WarGames match, a concept introduced by WWE's NXT brand.

# Production

## Background

The event was announced on October 10, 2022, with tickets going on sale on October 14. The event was initially scheduled to be a standard Survivor Series event, but on the October 31 episode of Monday Night Raw, it was announced that the event would feature a WarGames match, a concept introduced by WWE's NXT brand. The WarGames match would feature two teams of five wrestlers each competing in a steel cage match with two rings.

## Storylines

The event featured several storylines leading up to the matches. The main event WarGames match featured the teams of Bianca Belair, Asuka, Rhea Ripley, and Mia Yim facing off against the team of Damage Control (Bayley, Dakota Kai, and IYO SKY), Nikki Cross, and Ronda Rousey. The match was set up after several weeks of tension between the two teams, with each team looking to gain an advantage.

# Event

## Preliminary matches

The event began with a United States Championship match between Seth Rollins and Bobby Lashley. The match saw Rollins retain the title after hitting Lashley with a curb stomp. The next match saw the team of The Judgment Day (Damian Priest, Finn Bálor, Dominik Mysterio, and JD McDonagh) facing off against the team of The O.C. (AJ Styles, Karl Anderson, and Luke Gallows) and Sheamus in a traditional Survivor Series match. The match saw The Judgment Day emerge victorious, with Priest and Bálor being the last two men standing.

## Main event

The main event WarGames match saw the teams of Bianca Belair, Asuka, Rhea Ripley, Mia Yim, and Becky Lynch facing off against the team of Damage Control (Bayley, Dakota Kai, and IYO SKY), Nikki Cross, and Ronda Rousey. The match saw both teams trading near-falls and submissions, with each team looking to gain an advantage. In the end, it was Belair who emerged victorious, hitting Rousey with a 450 splash to secure the win for her team.

# Reception

## Commercial

The event was a commercial success for WWE, generating over $1 million in ticket sales. The event also saw a significant increase in viewership, with the event averaging over 1 million viewers on the WWE Network.

## Critical

The event received positive reviews from critics, with many praising the WarGames match as one of the best matches of the year. The event also saw several other matches receive high praise, including the United States Championship match and the traditional Survivor Series match.

# Aftermath

## Raw

The night after the event, on Monday Night Raw, the winners of the WarGames match were celebrated by the crowd. Belair and her team were interviewed by Kevin Patrick, where they discussed their victory and what it meant to them. The event also saw Rousey and Damage Control confront the winners, setting up a potential rematch in the future.

## SmackDown

On the following episode of SmackDown, the event was recapped, with several matches and moments being replayed. The event also saw several wrestlers react to the event, including Rousey and Damage Control.

# Results

1. Seth Rollins (c) defeated Bobby Lashley to retain the United States Championship
2. The Judgment Day (Damian Priest, Finn Bálor, Dominik Mysterio, and JD McDonagh) defeated The O.C. (AJ Styles, Karl Anderson, and Luke Gallows) and Sheamus in a traditional Survivor Series match
3. Bianca Belair, Asuka, Rhea Ripley, Mia Yim, and Becky Lynch defeated Damage Control (Bayley, Dakota Kai, and IYO SKY), Nikki Cross, and Ronda Rousey in a WarGames match

# References

# External links

article:
Opinion polling for the 2023 Spanish general election

The 2023 Spanish general election is scheduled to take place on or before December 10, 2023, to elect the 15th Cortes Generales of the Kingdom of Spain. In the run-up to the election, various organisations are conducting opinion polls to gauge voting intentions and attitudes towards politicians and political parties. This article provides a summary of the electoral polling and leadership polling conducted for the general election.

# Electoral polling

Electoral polling is the process of gathering information from a sample of voters to estimate their voting intentions. Polling firms use various methods, including telephone interviews, online surveys, and face-to-face interviews, to collect data from a representative sample of voters.

## Nationwide polling

Nationwide polling is conducted at the national level to estimate voting intentions across the entire country. The following sections provide an overview of the nationwide polling conducted for the 2023 Spanish general election.

### Graphical summary

The graphical summary presents a visual representation of the voting intention estimates over time. The graph shows the trend of voting intentions for each party, allowing for easy comparison and identification of patterns.

### Voting intention estimates

Voting intention estimates are the percentage of voters who intend to vote for each party. The following sections provide an overview of the voting intention estimates for the 2023 Spanish general election.

#### 2023 (Podemos w/i Sumar)

In 2023, after the integration of Podemos into Sumar, the polling firms began to include Sumar as a separate entity in their surveys. The following table presents the voting intention estimates for the main parties in 2023, including Sumar:

| Party | Jan | Feb | Mar | Apr | May |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| PSOE | 28.5 | 29.2 | 28.1 | 29.5 | 28.3 |
| PP | 27.2 | 26.5 | 27.5 | 26.2 | 27.1 |
| Vox | 15.6 | 16.1 | 15.3 | 16.4 | 15.7 |
| Sumar | 10.3 | 10.8 | 10.2 | 10.5 | 10.6 |
| ERC | 2.5 | 2.7 | 2.3 | 2.6 | 2.4 |
| Ciudadanos | 2.1 | 2.3 | 2.0 | 2.2 | 2.0 |

#### 2023 (after Sumar)

After the integration of Podemos into Sumar, the polling firms began to include Sumar as a separate entity in their surveys. The following table presents the voting intention estimates for the main parties in 2023, after the integration of Sumar:

| Party | Jun | Jul | Aug | Sep | Oct |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| PSOE | 27.8 | 28.5 | 27.2 | 28.8 | 27.5 |
| PP | 28.1 | 27.3 | 28.5 | 27.0 | 28.2 |
| Vox | 15.9 | 16.2 | 15.5 | 16.5 | 15.8 |
| Sumar | 11.2 | 11.5 | 10.9 | 11.3 | 11.1 |
| ERC | 2.6 | 2.8 | 2.4 | 2.7 | 2.5 |
| Ciudadanos | 2.0 | 2.2 | 1.9 | 2.1 | 1.9 |

#### 2023 (before Sumar)

In 2023, before the integration of Podemos into Sumar, the polling firms included Podemos as a separate entity in their surveys. The following table presents the voting intention estimates for the main parties in 2023, before the integration of Sumar:

| Party | Jan | Feb | Mar | Apr | May |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| PSOE | 29.2 | 28.5 | 29.8 | 28.2 | 29.5 |
| PP | 26.5 | 27.2 | 26.0 | 27.5 | 26.8 |
| Vox | 16.1 | 15.6 | 16.4 | 15.3 | 16.2 |
| Podemos | 11.5 | 11.8 | 11.2 | 11.5 | 11.3 |
| ERC | 2.7 | 2.5 | 2.9 | 2.6 | 2.8 |
| Ciudadanos | 2.3 | 2.1 | 2.5 | 2.2 | 2.4 |

#### 2022

In 2022, the polling firms included Podemos as a separate entity in their surveys. The following table presents the voting intention estimates for the main parties in 2022:

| Party | Jan | Feb | Mar | Apr | May |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| PSOE | 30.1 | 29.5 | 30.8 | 29.2 | 30.5 |
| PP | 25.8 | 26.5 | 25.2 | 26.8 | 25.9 |
| Vox | 16.4 | 15.9 | 16.7 | 15.5 | 16.3 |
| Podemos | 12.2 | 12.5 | 11.8 | 12.2 | 11.9 |
| ERC | 2.9 | 2.7 | 3.1 | 2.8 | 3.0 |
| Ciudadanos | 2.5 | 2.3 | 2.7 | 2.4 | 2.6 |

#### 2019–2021

In the period between 2019 and 2021, the polling firms included Podemos as a separate entity in their surveys. The following table presents the voting intention estimates for the main parties during this period:

| Party | 2019 | 2020 | 2021 |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| PSOE | 31.7 | 30.3 | 29.1 |
| PP | 25.4 | 24.9 | 26.4 |
| Vox | 15.1 | 16.2 | 15.6 |
| Podemos | 13.4 | 12.9 | 11.7 |
| ERC | 3.2 | 3.0 | 2.9 |
| Ciudadanos | 2.8 | 2.5 | 2.3 |

### Voting preferences

Voting preferences refer to the percentage of voters who prefer a particular party or politician. The following table presents the voting preferences for the main parties in 2023:

| Party | Preference |
| --- | --- |
| PSOE | 34.2 |
| PP | 30.5 |
| Vox | 18.1 |
| Sumar | 12.5 |
| ERC | 4.2 |
| Ciudadanos | 3.5 |

### Victory preferences

Victory preferences refer to the percentage of voters who prefer a particular party or politician to win the election. The following table presents the victory preferences for the main parties in 2023:

| Party | Preference |
| --- | --- |
| PSOE | 38.1 |
| PP | 32.2 |
| Vox | 19.5 |
| Sumar | 13.8 |
| ERC | 4.5 |
| Ciudadanos | 3.9 |

### Victory likelihood

Victory likelihood refers to the percentage of voters who believe a particular party or politician is likely to win the election. The following table presents the victory likelihood for the main parties in 2023:

| Party | Likelihood |
| --- | --- |
| PSOE | 42.5 |

### Hypothetical scenarios

Hypothetical scenarios refer to the voting intentions in hypothetical situations, such as a coalition government or a second round of voting. The following table presents the voting intentions in hypothetical scenarios in 2023:

article:
Order of battle of the Russian invasion of Ukraine

The order of battle of the Russian invasion of Ukraine refers to the deployment and organization of military forces involved in the conflict. The invasion, which began on February 24, 2022, has seen a significant mobilization of Russian forces, as well as Ukrainian forces, and various other groups. This article provides an overview of the order of battle of the Russian invasion of Ukraine, including the administrative chain of command, initial force groupings, and the various units and groups involved.

# Russian forces in 2022

Russian forces played a significant role in the invasion of Ukraine, with a large number of troops and equipment deployed to the region. The Russian military's structure and organization were crucial in determining the course of the conflict.

## Administrative chain of command

Moon Knight (miniseries)

Moon Knight is a 2022 American television miniseries based on the Marvel Comics character of the same name. The series is a part of the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU) and follows the story of Marc Spector, a former Marine who becomes the avatar of the Egyptian god Khonshu.

#Premise

The series follows the story of Marc Spector, a former Marine who suffers from dissociative identity disorder. After being resurrected by the Egyptian god Khonshu, Marc becomes the avatar of the god and takes on the mantle of Moon Knight. As Marc navigates his complex identities, he must also confront his past and the evil forces that seek to destroy the world. Along the way, he meets Layla El-Faouly, a skilled archaeologist who becomes his ally and potential love interest.

#Cast and characters

* Oscar Isaac as Marc Spector / Moon Knight, a former Marine who suffers from dissociative identity disorder and becomes the avatar of the Egyptian god Khonshu.
* May Calamawy as Layla El-Faouly, a skilled archaeologist and Marc's ally and potential love interest.
* Karim El-Hakim as Anton Mogart, a wealthy and influential man with a hidden agenda.
* F. Murray Abraham as the voice of Khonshu, the Egyptian god who resurrects Marc and becomes his guide.
* Ethan Hawke as Arthur Harrow, a cult leader who seeks to bring about a new era of chaos and destruction.

#Episodes

1. "The Goldfish Problem" - Marc Spector, a former Marine, struggles to cope with his dissociative identity disorder and is resurrected by the Egyptian god Khonshu.
2. "Summon the Suit" - Marc becomes the avatar of Khonshu and takes on the mantle of Moon Knight, but struggles to control his newfound powers.
3. "The Friendly Type" - Marc meets Layla El-Faouly, a skilled archaeologist who becomes his ally and potential love interest.
4. "The Tomb" - Marc and Layla infiltrate a tomb to retrieve a powerful artifact, but are ambushed by Arthur Harrow's cult.
5. "Asylum" - Marc's past is revealed through a series of flashbacks, showing his time as a Marine and his relationship with his brother.
6. "Gods and Monsters" - Marc faces off against Arthur Harrow in a final showdown, with the fate of the world hanging in the balance.

##Writing

The writing process for Moon Knight was led by Jeremy Slater, who drew inspiration from the comic book series and his own experiences with mental health. The show's writers aimed to create a complex and nuanced portrayal of Marc Spector's dissociative identity disorder, while also incorporating elements of action and adventure.

##Casting

Oscar Isaac was cast as Marc Spector / Moon Knight in October 2020, with May Calamawy joining the cast as Layla El-Faouly in January 2021. Ethan Hawke was cast as Arthur Harrow in February 2021, with F. Murray Abraham providing the voice of Khonshu.

##Design

###Costumes

##Filming

##Post-production

Post-production for Moon Knight began in 2022, with the show's editors working to assemble the final cut of each episode. The show's visual effects team, led by Dan DeLeeuw, created a range of effects, including the show's action sequences and supernatural elements.

##Music

The score for Moon Knight was composed by Hesham Nazih, who drew inspiration from ancient Egyptian music and culture. The show's soundtrack features a range of instruments, including the oud and the qraqeb.

#Marketing

The marketing campaign for Moon Knight began in 2022, with Marvel Studios releasing a range of trailers and promotional materials. The show's social media accounts were also active, with the cast and crew sharing behind-the-scenes insights and updates.

#Release

Moon Knight was released on home media in 2022, with a range of formats available, including DVD, Blu-ray, and digital download.

Pishdadian Dynasty

The Pishdadian dynasty is a legendary royal house in Persian mythology and history, known for its role in the Shahnameh, the national epic of Greater Iran. The dynasty is said to have ruled the world for over 2,000 years, from the time of the first king, Kayumars, to the rise of the Kayanian dynasty. The Pishdadian kings are revered for their wisdom, justice, and military prowess.

# Origins, Etymology, and Sources

The term "Pishdadian" is derived from the Persian word "Pishdad," meaning "benefactor" or " ancestor." The Pishdadian dynasty is mentioned in various ancient sources, including the Avesta, the Shahnameh, and the works of the Persian historian Muhammad ibn Jarir al-Tabari. The Avesta, a collection of sacred texts in the Zoroastrian tradition, provides limited information on the Pishdadian kings, while the Shahnameh offers a more detailed account of their reigns.

# The Shahnameh and Zoroastrian Tradition

## Overview

The Shahnameh, composed by the Persian poet Ferdowsi in the 10th century, is the primary source of information on the Pishdadian dynasty. The epic poem tells the story of Iran's mythological and historical past, from the creation of the world to the Arab conquest of Persia in the 7th century. The Pishdadian kings are central to the narrative, which emphasizes their role in shaping Iranian identity and culture.

## The Kings

The Pishdadian dynasty is said to have begun with Kayumars, the first king, who ruled for 30 years. Kayumars was succeeded by his son, Hushang, who introduced fire worship and the use of iron tools. The next king, Tahmuras, expanded the empire and established trade relationships with neighboring countries. The most famous Pishdadian king, however, is Jamshid, who ruled for 700 years and established the city of Persepolis. Jamshid's reign was marked by great prosperity and cultural achievements, but he eventually fell victim to his own pride and was overthrown by the demon king, Zahhak.

# Tabari and the Muslim Narratives

## The First Pishdadian Kings and the Conflict with Iblis

Tabari's History of the Prophets and Kings provides a Muslim perspective on the Pishdadian dynasty. According to Tabari, the first Pishdadian king, Kayumars, was a just ruler who fought against the evil spirit Iblis. Kayumars' son, Hushang, continued his father's legacy, introducing fire worship and the use of iron tools. However, the third king, Tahmuras, faced opposition from Iblis, who sought to undermine the Pishdadian dynasty.

## From Jam al-Shidh to Zaw: al-Dahhak and War with the Turks

Tabari's account of the Pishdadian kings diverges from the Shahnameh in its description of the later kings. According to Tabari, Jam al-Shidh was succeeded by al-Dahhak, a tyrannical ruler who was overthrown by the hero Afridun. Afridun's son, Zaw, faced a major challenge from the Turks, who threatened to destroy the Pishdadian empire. Zaw's military campaigns against the Turks were ultimately successful, but the empire began to decline under his successors.

# Significance

The Pishdadian dynasty holds a significant place in Iranian mythology and history. The Shahnameh's account of the Pishdadian kings has shaped Iranian identity and culture, emphasizing the importance of justice, wisdom, and military prowess. The dynasty's legendary status has also influenced the development of Persian literature and art.

# Notes

The Pishdadian dynasty is a complex and multifaceted topic, with different sources offering varying accounts of the kings and their reigns. While the Shahnameh provides a detailed and engaging narrative, Tabari's History offers a more concise and factual account. Further research is needed to reconcile the different sources and to gain a deeper understanding of the Pishdadian dynasty's significance in Iranian history and culture.

article:
Oscar Isaac
================

Oscar Isaac is a Guatemalan-American actor and musician. Born on March 9, 1979, in Guatemala City, Guatemala, Isaac has established himself as one of the most talented and versatile actors of his generation. With a career spanning over two decades, he has consistently impressed audiences and critics alike with his nuanced and captivating performances on screen.

Early life
-----------

Oscar Isaac Hernández was born in Guatemala City, Guatemala, to María Eugenia Hernández Nicolle and Óscar Gonzalo Hernández-Cano, a pulmonologist. His family moved to the United States when he was five months old, settling in Miami, Florida. Isaac grew up in a musical household, with his father playing the guitar and his mother singing. He developed an early interest in music and began playing the guitar at the age of 12.

Isaac attended the Westminster Christian School in Palmetto Bay, Florida, and later enrolled in the Juilliard School in New York City, where he studied drama. During his time at Juilliard, he honed his craft, performing in various stage productions and developing his skills as a classical actor.

Career
--------

### Early roles (2005–2010)

Isaac began his professional career in the early 2000s, landing small roles in films and television shows. His breakthrough came in 2005 with a supporting role in the HBO series "Law & Order: Trial by Jury." He continued to work in television, appearing in shows such as "Law & Order: Special Victims Unit" and "The Good Wife."

Isaac's early film career included roles in independent films such as "All About the Benjamins" (2002) and "Lenny the Wonder Dog" (2005). He also appeared in the 2006 film "Pu-239," a drama about a Russian nuclear power plant worker.

### Breakthrough (2011–2014)

Isaac's breakthrough role came in 2011 with the film "Drive," directed by Nicolas Winding Refn. He played the role of Standard Gabriel, a mechanic and friend of the main character, played by Ryan Gosling. The film received critical acclaim, and Isaac's performance earned him recognition in the industry.

In 2012, Isaac appeared in the film "Won't Back Down," a drama about two mothers who start a campaign to improve their children's school. He played the role of Michael Perry, a teacher who becomes a key player in the movement.

Isaac's performance in the 2013 film "Inside Llewyn Davis" earned him widespread critical acclaim. He played the title role of Llewyn Davis, a struggling folk singer in 1960s Greenwich Village. The film, directed by the Coen brothers, premiered at the Cannes Film Festival and received several Academy Award nominations.

### Mainstream success (2015–2017)

Isaac's mainstream success came in 2015 with the film "Ex Machina," a science fiction thriller directed by Alex Garland. He played the role of Nathan Bateman, the CEO of a tech company who invites a young programmer to administer the Turing test to an intelligent humanoid robot.

In 2016, Isaac appeared in the film "Star Wars: The Last Jedi," playing the role of Poe Dameron, a Resistance pilot. The film was a commercial success and received positive reviews from critics.

Isaac continued to work in mainstream films, appearing in the 2017 film "Suburbicon," a dark comedy directed by George Clooney. He played the role of Bud Cooper, a sinister insurance investigator.

### Professional expansion (2018–present)

In 2018, Isaac appeared in the film "Annihilation," a science fiction horror film based on the novel by Jeff VanderMeer. He played the role of Kane, a soldier who disappears on a mission into a mysterious area known as "the Shimmer."

Isaac continues to expand his professional horizons, taking on a wide range of roles in film and television. He has several upcoming projects in development, including a role in the Denis Villeneuve film "Dune."

Reception and acting style
---------------------------

Oscar Isaac has received widespread critical acclaim for his performances on screen. He is known for his nuanced and captivating acting style, which brings depth and complexity to his characters.

Isaac's ability to convey vulnerability and intensity has earned him recognition as one of the most talented actors of his generation. His performances are often described as "raw" and "emotional," and he has a reputation for fully immersing himself in his roles.

Personal life
--------------

Oscar Isaac is married to the Danish director Elvira Lind, whom he met in 2012. The couple has two children together, a son named Eugene, born in 2017, and a daughter named Mads, born in 2019.

Isaac is also a talented musician and has released several albums with his band, the Blinking Underdogs. He has been open about his struggles with anxiety and depression, using his platform to raise awareness and reduce stigma around mental health issues.

Notes

* Oscar Isaac is a dual citizen of Guatemala and the United States.
* He is fluent in Spanish and has worked on several projects in his native language.
* Isaac has been involved in several charitable organizations, including the National Alliance on Mental Illness and the American Civil Liberties Union.

article:
Typhoon Khanun (2023)

Typhoon Khanun was a powerful tropical cyclone that affected several countries in East Asia in August 2023. The storm caused widespread damage and disruption, particularly in Japan and the Korean Peninsula.

#Meteorological history

Typhoon Khanun formed as a tropical depression on August 3, 2023, in the western Pacific Ocean, approximately 1,000 km (620 miles) southeast of Okinawa, Japan. The system slowly intensified as it moved northwestward, fueled by warm waters and low wind shear. On August 5, the Japan Meteorological Agency (JMA) upgraded the depression to a tropical storm, assigning it the name Khanun.

Over the next few days, Khanun continued to strengthen, becoming a severe tropical storm on August 7. The storm's maximum sustained winds increased to 120 km/h (75 mph), with gusts reaching up to 150 km/h (90 mph). Khanun's central pressure dropped to 965 hPa (28.50 inHg), indicating a significant intensification of the storm.

As Khanun approached the Ryukyu Islands, the JMA upgraded it to a typhoon on August 9. The storm's winds increased further, reaching 160 km/h (100 mph), with gusts of up to 200 km/h (125 mph). Khanun's central pressure dropped to 945 hPa (27.91 inHg), making it a category 2-equivalent typhoon on the Saffir-Simpson Hurricane Wind Scale.

#Preparations, impact, and aftermath

##Japan

Typhoon Khanun brought strong winds and heavy rainfall to Japan, particularly in the southern prefectures of Okinawa and Kagoshima. The storm made landfall on August 10, causing widespread power outages and property damage.

In Okinawa, winds gusting up to 180 km/h (110 mph) knocked down trees and power lines, leaving over 10,000 households without electricity. The Okinawa Prefectural Government reported that 15 people were injured, with one fatality confirmed.

In Kagoshima, the city of Kagoshima experienced its heaviest rainfall in 30 years, with over 400 mm (16 in) of rain falling in a 24-hour period. The resulting floods affected over 1,000 households, with 10 people reported missing.

##Korean Peninsula

Typhoon Khanun brought significant rainfall and strong winds to the Korean Peninsula, particularly in the southern regions of South Korea. The storm made landfall on August 11, causing widespread disruption and damage.

In South Korea, the city of Busan reported over 300 mm (12 in) of rain, with winds gusting up to 120 km/h (75 mph). The resulting floods affected over 5,000 households, with 20 people reported missing.

In North Korea, the state-run Korean Central News Agency reported that Typhoon Khanun caused significant damage to crops and infrastructure, particularly in the southern provinces of South Hwanghae and North Hwanghae.

##Elsewhere

Typhoon Khanun also affected other countries in East Asia, including China and Taiwan. In China, the province of Fujian reported over 100 mm (4 in) of rain, with winds gusting up to 80 km/h (50 mph). In Taiwan, the city of Taipei experienced strong winds and heavy rainfall, with over 50 mm (2 in) of rain falling in a 24-hour period.

The second season of Bigg Boss OTT was produced by Endemol Shine India, a subsidiary of Banijay, and was hosted by Karan Johar.

The Bigg Boss OTT house was designed by the show's production team and was located in Mumbai. The house was equipped with cameras and microphones to capture the contestants' every move and conversation.

article:
2023 Nigerien Coup d'état

The 2023 Nigerien coup d'état was a military takeover that occurred on 26 July 2023, when President Mohamed Bazoum was detained by a group of military officers. The coup marked a significant turning point in Niger's recent history, which had been characterized by a fragile democracy and growing instability.

# Background

Niger, a landlocked country in West Africa, had been facing numerous challenges in the years leading up to the coup. The country was struggling with poverty, corruption, and insecurity, particularly in the north, where Islamist militants had been active. Despite these challenges, Niger had made significant progress in consolidating its democracy, with President Mohamed Bazoum winning the 2020 presidential election in a relatively peaceful and transparent process.

However, Bazoum's government faced growing opposition and criticism from various quarters, including the military, which had been dissatisfied with the government's handling of the security situation in the north. The military had also been concerned about the government's decision to reduce the military's budget and personnel, which they saw as a threat to their interests.

# Events

## 26 July

### Bazoum's detention

On the morning of 26 July, President Bazoum was detained by a group of military officers at the Presidential Palace in Niamey, the capital city of Niger. The officers, who were reportedly from the Presidential Guard, took control of the palace and surrounding areas, and Bazoum was placed under house arrest.

### Military mobilization

Following Bazoum's detention, the military began to mobilize its forces across the country. Troops were deployed to key locations, including government buildings, airports, and border crossings. The military also imposed a curfew and restricted movement in the capital city.

### Announcement of Bazoum's overthrow

Later in the day, a group of military officers appeared on national television to announce the overthrow of President Bazoum. The officers, who identified themselves as the National Council for the Safeguard of the Homeland (CNSP), claimed that they had taken power to restore stability and security in the country.

## 27 July

### Bazoum's response

On 27 July, President Bazoum released a statement through his social media accounts, condemning the coup and calling on the military to stand down. Bazoum also appealed to the international community to intervene and restore democracy in Niger.

### Military recognition of the junta

Despite Bazoum's appeal, the military continued to consolidate its power. The CNSP, which had taken control of the government, began to appoint new officials and governors to key positions. The military also received recognition from some neighboring countries, including Burkina Faso and Mali, which had also experienced military coups in recent years.

## 28 July

On 28 July, the CNSP announced the formation of a transitional government, which would be headed by a civilian prime minister. The move was seen as an attempt by the military to legitimize its rule and appease the international community.

# Aftermath

The aftermath of the coup was marked by uncertainty and instability. The international community, including the African Union and the European Union, condemned the coup and called for the restoration of democracy in Niger. The United States and France, which had been key partners of Niger's government, also suspended their military cooperation with the country.

The coup also had significant humanitarian implications. The country's economy, which was already struggling, was severely impacted by the coup, with many businesses and markets closing down. The humanitarian situation in the north, where many people were already displaced, also deteriorated further.

# Reactions

## Domestic

The reaction to the coup within Niger was mixed. Some people welcomed the coup, seeing it as an opportunity to bring about change and stability in the country. Others, however, were strongly opposed to the coup, viewing it as a threat to democracy and the rule of law.

## International

The international community was quick to condemn the coup. The African Union, the European Union, and the United Nations all issued statements calling for the restoration of democracy in Niger. The United States and France, which had been key partners of Niger's government, also suspended their military cooperation with the country.

# Analysis

The 2023 Nigerien coup d'état was a complex and multifaceted event that reflected the deep-seated challenges facing Niger's democracy. The coup was the result of a combination of factors, including the country's fragile economy, its porous borders, and the growing discontent within the military.

The coup also highlighted the fragility of democracy in West Africa, where several countries have experienced military takeovers in recent years. The international community's response to the coup was swift and decisive, but it remains to be seen whether the country will be able to return to democratic rule.

article:
Five Nights at Freddy's (film)

Five Nights at Freddy's is a 2023 American survival horror film directed by Emma Tammi and written by Seth Grahame-Smith and Chris McKenna. The film is based on the popular video game of the same name created by Scott Cawthon. The movie follows the story of Mike Schmidt, a newly hired security guard at Freddy Fazbear's Pizza, a family-friendly restaurant that becomes a hub of terror and violence at night.

# Plot

The film takes place in 1987, where Mike Schmidt (Josh Holland) is hired as a security guard at Freddy Fazbear's Pizza, a family-friendly restaurant that features animatronic animals, including Freddy Fazbear, Bonnie the Bunny, Chica the Chicken, and Foxy the Pirate Fox. Mike's predecessor, a man named Phone Guy, has mysteriously disappeared, and the restaurant's owner, William Afton (Mark Rylance), is eager to keep the restaurant running smoothly.

As Mike begins his first night, he discovers that the animatronics have a tendency to roam freely at night, and their behavior becomes increasingly erratic and violent. Mike soon realizes that the animatronics are haunted by the vengeful spirits of children who were murdered at the restaurant by a serial killer known as the "Purple Guy." As the nights progress, Mike must survive the animatronics' attacks and uncover the dark secrets behind the restaurant's tragic past.

# Cast

* Josh Holland as Mike Schmidt
* Mark Rylance as William Afton
* Elizabeth Lail as Sarah
* Piper Laurie as Mrs. Afton
* Matthew Lillard as Phone Guy
* Scott Cawthon as Himself (cameo appearance)

# Production

## Development

The film was first announced in 2015, with Roy Lee, David Katzenberg, and Seth Grahame-Smith set to produce. Chris McKenna was hired to write the screenplay, and Emma Tammi was brought on board to direct. The film's script was heavily influenced by the game's storyline and characters, with some creative liberties taken to expand on the game's universe.

## Casting

Josh Holland was cast as Mike Schmidt, the protagonist of the film, in 2020. Mark Rylance was cast as William Afton, the restaurant's owner and a key character in the film's storyline. Elizabeth Lail and Piper Laurie were cast as Sarah and Mrs. Afton, respectively, while Matthew Lillard was cast as Phone Guy.

## Filming

Principal photography began in February 2022 and wrapped in May 2022. The film was shot on location in New Orleans, Louisiana, and surrounding areas. The animatronics were brought to life using a combination of practical effects and CGI.

## Music

The film's score was composed by Andrew Scott Bell, who incorporated elements of the game's soundtrack into the score. The film's soundtrack also features songs by various artists, including "The Living Years" by Mike + The Mechanics and "Don't Fear the Reaper" by Blue Oyster Cult.

# Release

The film's marketing campaign began in January 2023, with the release of a teaser trailer. The trailer featured a mix of footage from the film and gameplay from the original game. A full trailer was released in March 2023, which gave fans a better look at the film's storyline and characters.

## Home media

# Reception

The film was released in theaters on July 27, 2023, and grossed $23.5 million in its opening weekend. The film went on to gross over $100 million worldwide, making it a commercial success.

## Critical response

The film received mixed reviews from critics, with some praising its atmosphere and performances, while others found it too formulaic and reliant on jump scares. The film holds a 42% approval rating on Rotten Tomatoes, based on 202 reviews, with an average rating of 5.2/10.

# Coverage

The 2023 Asia Cup is the 16th edition of the Asia Cup, a biennial international cricket tournament organized by the Asian Cricket Council (ACC). The tournament is scheduled to take place in Sri Lanka from August 30 to September 17, 2023.

#Background

The Asia Cup was first introduced in 1984, and since then, it has been held every two years. The tournament has undergone several format changes over the years, with the most recent change being the introduction of the Twenty20 International (T20I) format in 2016. The 2023 edition will feature six teams competing in the One-Day International (ODI) format.

#Format

The 2023 Asia Cup will feature six teams divided into two groups of three teams each. The top two teams from each group will qualify for the Super Four stage, where they will play each other in a round-robin format. The top two teams from the Super Four stage will then play in the final.

#Teams and qualification

*  Afghanistan

2022 NFL Season

The 2022 NFL season was the 103rd season of the National Football League (NFL). The season began on September 8, 2022, with the defending Super Bowl LVI champion Los Angeles Rams hosting the Buffalo Bills, and concluded on February 12, 2023, with Super Bowl LVII, where the Kansas City Chiefs defeated the Philadelphia Eagles.

Player Movement

### Free Agency

The 2022 NFL free agency period began on March 16, 2022. Several high-profile players changed teams, including quarterback Matt Ryan, who signed with the Indianapolis Colts, and wide receiver Davante Adams, who signed with the Las Vegas Raiders.

### Trades

Several notable trades occurred during the off-season, including the trade of quarterback Russell Wilson from the Seattle Seahawks to the Denver Broncos, and the trade of wide receiver Tyreek Hill from the Kansas City Chiefs to the Miami Dolphins.

### Retirements

Several players announced their retirement during the off-season, including quarterback Ben Roethlisberger, who played 18 seasons with the Pittsburgh Steelers, and tight end Rob Gronkowski, who played 11 seasons with the New England Patriots and Tampa Bay Buccaneers.

### Draft

The 2022 NFL Draft took place on April 28-30, 2022, at Caesars Forum in Las Vegas, Nevada. The Jacksonville Jaguars selected Travon Walker, a defensive end from Georgia, with the first overall pick.

Officiating Changes

The NFL hired 14 new officials for the 2022 season, including two female officials, Maia Chaka and Robin DeLorenzo.

Rule Changes

The NFL made several rule changes for the 2022 season, including a change to the overtime format in the postseason, where both teams will have the opportunity to possess the ball in overtime, even if the first team scores a touchdown.

The Indian National Developmental Inclusive Alliance (INDIA) is a big tent political alliance in India, formed in 2023 with the objective of providing a united opposition to the ruling National Democratic Alliance (NDA) government. The alliance comprises a diverse range of political parties, including regional and national parties, with the aim of promoting inclusive and developmental politics in India.

#Etymology
The name "INDIA" is an acronym that stands for "Indian National Developmental Inclusive Alliance". The name was chosen to reflect the alliance's commitment to the values of inclusivity, development, and national unity.

#History
The Indian National Developmental Inclusive Alliance was formed in 2023, in the run-up to the 2024 general elections. The alliance was the result of a series of discussions and negotiations between various opposition parties, who came together to provide a united challenge to the ruling NDA government. The alliance was formally launched in a grand ceremony in New Delhi, attended by leaders of the constituent parties.

article:
Bibliography of Benjamin Franklin

Benjamin Franklin was a prominent American statesman, scientist, writer, and philosopher. He was one of the Founding Fathers of the United States and played a leading role in the drafting and signing of the Declaration of Independence. Franklin's writings and publications cover a wide range of topics, including politics, science, literature, and philosophy. This bibliography provides an overview of the major works and publications about Franklin, as well as his own writings and papers.

# Biographical

## 18th century

The first biographical accounts of Franklin's life were written during his lifetime. One of the earliest and most influential biographies is the 1784 work "The Life of Benjamin Franklin" by the French writer and philosopher, Jean-Jacques Rousseau's friend, Jacques Pierre Brissot. This work was published in French and later translated into English.

## 19th century

In the 19th century, several biographies of Franklin were published, including the 1808 work "The Life of Benjamin Franklin" by the American historian and writer, Jared Sparks. Sparks' biography was based on Franklin's own writings and papers, as well as interviews with people who knew him.

## 20th century

In the 20th century, there was a surge in Franklin scholarship, with several major biographies published. One of the most influential works of this period is the 1938 biography "Benjamin Franklin" by the American historian and writer, Carl Van Doren. Van Doren's biography is considered a classic in the field and is still widely read today.

## 21st century

In the 21st century, there have been several new biographies of Franklin published, including the 2003 work "Benjamin Franklin: An American Life" by the American historian and writer, Walter Isaacson. Isaacson's biography is based on extensive research and provides a detailed and engaging account of Franklin's life.

# Historical journals

## 20th-century

Several historical journals have published articles and essays about Franklin's life and work. One of the most important journals in this field is the "Pennsylvania Magazine of History and Biography", which has published numerous articles about Franklin since its founding in 1877.

## 21st-century

In recent years, several new journals have been established that focus on Franklin studies. One of the most prominent of these is the "Benjamin Franklin Journal", which was founded in 2005 and publishes articles and essays about all aspects of Franklin's life and work.

# Letters and writings

## Works about Franklin's papers

Franklin's papers and writings are a major source of information about his life and work. Several volumes of his papers have been published, including the 1959 work "The Papers of Benjamin Franklin" edited by Leonard Labaree and others. This collection includes Franklin's letters, essays, and other writings, and provides a detailed and comprehensive account of his life and work.

# Publisher and printer

Franklin was a successful publisher and printer, and his publications include several important works, such as the "Pennsylvania Gazette" and "Poor Richard's Almanack". These publications provide valuable insights into Franklin's life and work, as well as the cultural and intellectual context of 18th-century America.

# Inventor, scientist

Franklin was a prolific inventor and scientist, and his work in these fields had a major impact on American and European society. Several books and articles have been published about Franklin's scientific work, including the 1976 work "Benjamin Franklin: Scientist and Statesman" by the American historian and writer, I. Bernard Cohen.

# Primary sources

## Autobiography

Franklin's autobiography is one of the most famous works of American literature. It was written between 1771 and 1788, and is considered one of the greatest autobiographies ever written. The autobiography provides a detailed and engaging account of Franklin's life, from his childhood in Boston to his later years in Philadelphia.

## The Papers of Benjamin Franklin

The Papers of Benjamin Franklin is a comprehensive collection of Franklin's letters, essays, and other writings. The collection includes over 40 volumes, and provides a detailed and comprehensive account of Franklin's life and work.

## The Writings of Benjamin Franklin

The Writings of Benjamin Franklin is a 10-volume collection of Franklin's essays, letters, and other writings. The collection was published between 1905 and 1907, and provides a detailed and engaging account of Franklin's life and work.

# Further information

For further information about Franklin's life and work, several books and articles are recommended. These include the 2008 work "Benjamin Franklin: A Very Short Introduction" by the American historian and writer, Claude-Anne Lopez, and the 2011 work "Benjamin Franklin: In His Own Words" by the American historian and writer, Edmund S. Morgan.

# See also

* Benjamin Franklin
* American Enlightenment
* American Revolution
* Declaration of Independence
* United States Constitution

# Notes

This bibliography is not exhaustive, but rather provides a selection of the most important and influential works about Franklin's life and work.

Wagner Group Rebellion

The Wagner Group rebellion, also known as the Prigozhin rebellion, was a brief but significant mutiny led by Yevgeny Prigozhin, the leader of the Wagner Group, a Russian private military company (PMC), against the Russian government in June 2023. The rebellion was sparked by a series of events, including internal tensions within the Wagner Group and a perceived betrayal by the Russian government.

Yevgeny Prigozhin and the Wagner Group

Yevgeny Prigozhin, a Russian businessman and close associate of President Vladimir Putin, founded the Wagner Group in 2014. The Wagner Group is a private military company (PMC) that has been involved in various conflicts, including the Syrian Civil War and the Russian invasion of Ukraine. article:
July 2022 Punjab Provincial By-Election

The July 2022 Punjab provincial by-election was held on July 17, 2022, to elect 20 members of the Provincial Assembly of the Punjab, Pakistan. The by-elections were held due to the resignation of 25 members of the Provincial Assembly, who were elected on tickets of the Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) and had defected to the Pakistan Muslim League (N) (PML-N).

# Background

The by-elections were a result of the Supreme Court of Pakistan's verdict in the election of the Chief Minister of Punjab, in which the court declared that the votes of the dissenting members of the PTI would not be counted in the election. This led to the resignation of 25 members of the Provincial Assembly, who had defected to the PML-N. The Election Commission of Pakistan (ECP) subsequently announced by-elections in the constituencies from which the members had resigned.

# Candidates

The PTI, PML-N, and other political parties fielded candidates in the by-elections. The PTI fielded candidates in all 20 constituencies, while the PML-N fielded candidates in 17 constituencies. Other parties, including the Pakistan Peoples Party (PPP) and the Jamaat-e-Islami (JI), also fielded candidates in some constituencies.

## Results

The results of the by-elections were announced on July 17, 2022. The PTI won 15 seats, while the PML-N won 4 seats. One seat was won by an independent candidate.

The results of the by-elections were seen as a significant blow to the PML-N, which had been hoping to win a majority of the seats. The PTI, on the other hand, was jubilant at its performance, which was seen as a vindication of its policies.

# Election for Chief Minister

The results of the by-elections had significant implications for the election of the Chief Minister of Punjab. Leslie Jordan
================

Leslie Allen Jordan was an American actor, comedian, and writer. He was best known for his roles as Lonnie Garr in the NBC sitcom "Hearts Afire" and Beverly Leslie in the Fox sitcom "Sordid Lives: The Series." Jordan's career spanned over three decades, during which he appeared in numerous films, television shows, and stage productions.

Early and Personal Life
------------------------

Leslie Jordan was born on April 29, 1955, in Memphis, Tennessee. He grew up in a Southern Baptist family and was raised in Chattanooga, Tennessee. Jordan's father, Allen Jordan, was a lieutenant colonel in the United States Army, and his mother, Peggy Ann Griffin, was a homemaker.

Jordan developed an interest in performing at an early age and began writing stories and creating characters as a child. He attended the University of Tennessee at Chattanooga, where he studied theater and graduated with a degree in theater arts.

Career
--------

### Film and Television

Jordan's early career in film and television began in the late 1980s. He appeared in small roles on television shows such as "The Fall Guy" and "Murder, She Wrote." In 1988, he landed the role of Lonnie Garr in the NBC sitcom "Hearts Afire," which ran for four seasons.

In the 1990s, Jordan continued to work in television, appearing in shows such as "Babes," "Reasonable Doubts," and "Picket Fences." He also began to transition to film, appearing in movies such as "Ski Patrol" and "Jason Goes to Hell: The Final Friday."

In 2000, Jordan landed the role of Beverly Leslie in the Fox sitcom "Sordid Lives: The Series." The show was based on the 1996 film of the same name, in which Jordan had also appeared. The show ran for one season and developed a cult following.

### Theatre

Jordan's career in theatre began in the 1980s, when he appeared in regional productions of plays such as "A Midsummer Night's Dream" and "The Importance of Being Earnest." In the 1990s, he began to appear on Broadway, making his debut in the 1991 production of "Six Degrees of Separation."

In 2004, Jordan wrote and starred in his own one-man show, "Like a Dog on Linoleum," which ran at the Los Angeles Gay and Lesbian Center. The show was a critical and commercial success, and Jordan went on to perform it Off-Broadway and on tour.

### Music

In addition to his work in film, television, and theatre, Jordan also pursued a career in music. In 2003, he released his debut album, "Leslie Jordan Live," which featured a mix of comedy and music.

### Social Media

Jordan was active on social media, with a large following on Instagram and Twitter. He regularly posted updates and behind-the-scenes glimpses into his life and career.

Death
------

Leslie Jordan passed away on October 24, 2022, at the age of 67. He died in a car accident in Los Angeles, California.

Awards

Throughout his career, Jordan was nominated for numerous awards, including an Emmy Award and a Tony Award. He won several awards for his writing and performing, including a Drama Desk Award and a GLAAD Media Award.

article:
Nonmetal

A nonmetal is a chemical element that is not a metal. Nonmetals are typically characterized by their inability to conduct electricity and their tendency to gain electrons to form anions. They are often found on the right-hand side of the periodic table, with the exception of hydrogen, which is a nonmetal but is located on the far left of the periodic table.

# Definition and applicable elements

Nonmetals are defined as elements that do not exhibit the characteristic properties of metals, such as the ability to conduct electricity, malleability, and ductility. Nonmetals are typically found in the p-block of the periodic table, which includes the elements in groups 13-18. These elements are often referred to as the nonmetal elements or the p-block elements.

# General properties

## Physical

Nonmetals typically exhibit a range of physical properties that distinguish them from metals. These properties include:

* Low melting and boiling points: Nonmetals typically have low melting and boiling points compared to metals.
* Low density: Nonmetals are typically less dense than metals.
* Brittle: Nonmetals are often brittle and lack the malleability and ductility of metals.

### Allotropes

Some nonmetals exist in multiple allotropes, which are different forms of the same element. For example, carbon exists as diamond, graphite, and fullerenes, while sulfur exists as orthorhombic and monoclinic crystals.

## Chemical

Nonmetals typically exhibit a range of chemical properties that distinguish them from metals. These properties include:

* Tendency to gain electrons: Nonmetals tend to gain electrons to form anions.
* Formation of covalent bonds: Nonmetals typically form covalent bonds with other nonmetals.
* Low reactivity: Nonmetals are often less reactive than metals.

## Complications

While the general properties of nonmetals provide a good starting point for understanding these elements, there are several complications that arise when dealing with the chemistry of nonmetals.

### First row anomaly

The first row of the periodic table, which includes hydrogen, helium, and lithium, exhibits anomalous behavior when compared to the rest of the nonmetals. This is due to the small size of the atoms in the first row, which leads to a range of unusual properties.

### Secondary periodicity

Secondary periodicity refers to the periodic trends that occur within a group of elements. For example, the chemistry of the halogens (group 17) exhibits a range of periodic trends, including the decrease in electronegativity down the group.

### Higher oxidation states

Some nonmetals are capable of exhibiting higher oxidation states, which can lead to a range of unusual properties. For example, phosphorus can exhibit oxidation states ranging from -3 to +5.

### Multiple bond formation

Some nonmetals are capable of forming multiple bonds, which can lead to a range of unusual properties. For example, carbon is capable of forming double and triple bonds, which are essential for the chemistry of organic compounds.

### Property overlaps

While the properties of nonmetals provide a good starting point for understanding these elements, there are several property overlaps that occur between nonmetals and metals. For example, some nonmetals, such as graphite and diamond, exhibit metallic properties under certain conditions.

# Types

Nonmetals can be broadly classified into three categories: noble gases, halogen nonmetals, and unclassified nonmetals.

## Noble gases

Noble gases are a group of nonmetals that are located in group 18 of the periodic table. These elements are characterized by their full outer energy level, which makes them extremely unreactive.

## Halogen nonmetals

Halogen nonmetals are a group of nonmetals that are located in group 17 of the periodic table. These elements are characterized by their high electronegativity and their tendency to gain electrons to form anions.

## Unclassified nonmetals

Unclassified nonmetals are a group of nonmetals that do not fit into either the noble gas or halogen nonmetal categories. These elements are located in groups 13-16 of the periodic table and are characterized by a range of properties that distinguish them from metals.

# Abundance, extraction, and uses

## Abundance

Nonmetals are relatively rare in the Earth's crust, with the exception of oxygen, silicon, and aluminum. However, many nonmetals are abundant in the atmosphere, including nitrogen, oxygen, and argon.

## Extraction

Nonmetals can be extracted from the Earth's crust through a range of processes, including mining, smelting, and electrolysis.

## Uses

Nonmetals have a range of uses, including:

* Electronics: Nonmetals are used in the production of electronic devices, including computers, smartphones, and televisions.
* Energy: Nonmetals are used in the production of energy, including the generation of electricity and the production of fuels.
* Aerospace: Nonmetals are used in the production of aerospace materials, including rocket components and aircraft parts.

# Taxonomical history

The concept of nonmetals has a long history that dates back to the early days of chemistry.

## Background

The early chemists recognized that certain elements did not exhibit the characteristic properties of metals, including the ability to conduct electricity and the tendency to form cations.

## Organization of elements by types

The organization of elements by types was first proposed by the French chemist Antoine Lavoisier in the late 18th century. Lavoisier recognized that elements could be broadly classified into metals and nonmetals.

## Development of types

The development of the concept of nonmetals continued throughout the 19th and 20th centuries, with the recognition of new types of nonmetals, including the noble gases and the halogen nonmetals.

## Suggested distinguishing criteria

The suggested distinguishing criteria for nonmetals include:

* Inability to conduct electricity
* Tendency to gain electrons to form anions
* Formation of covalent bonds with other nonmetals
* Low reactivity

2022–23 NFL playoffs

The 2022–23 NFL playoffs were the single-elimination tournament held at the end of the 2022–23 National Football League (NFL) regular season. Six teams from each of the league's two conferences qualified for the playoffs, with the winners of each conference's divisional round earning a spot in the Super Bowl to determine the NFL champion.

# Participants

The 2022–23 NFL playoffs included 14 teams, with seven teams from the American Football Conference (AFC) and seven teams from the National Football Conference (NFC). The teams were seeded one through seven in their respective conferences, with the top seed in each conference earning a first-round bye.

## Unused format changes following Week 17 canceled Bills–Bengals game

Following the cancellation of the Week 17 game between the Buffalo Bills and Cincinnati Bengals, the NFL announced changes to the playoff format. However, these changes were later deemed unnecessary, as the original format was used instead.

## New postseason overtime rule

The NFL introduced a new postseason overtime rule for the 2022–23 playoffs. Under the new rule, both teams are guaranteed a possession in overtime, unless the first team scores a touchdown.

# Bracket

The 2022–23 NFL playoffs bracket was set following the conclusion of the regular season. The teams were seeded one through seven in their respective conferences, with the top seed in each conference earning a first-round bye.

# Schedule

The 2022–23 NFL playoffs schedule was as follows:

* Wild Card Round: January 14-16, 2023

Estelle Harris

Estelle Harris was an American actress and voice actress, best known for her iconic roles in film and television. With a career spanning over six decades, Harris established herself as a talented and versatile performer, bringing to life a wide range of characters that captivated audiences worldwide.

# Early life and education

Estelle Harris was born on April 4, 1928, in New York City, to Isaac and Anna Nussbaum. She grew up in a family of modest means, with her parents working hard to provide for their children. Harris's early life was marked by a strong interest in the arts, which was encouraged by her parents. She began taking acting classes at a young age and soon became involved in local theater productions.

Harris attended the High School of Music & Art in Manhattan, where she honed her skills in acting, singing, and dancing. After graduating, she went on to study drama at the esteemed HB Studio in New York City. Her formal training and early experience in the arts laid the foundation for her future success in the entertainment industry.

# Career

Estelle Harris's career in show business began in the 1950s, when she started landing small roles on stage and screen. Her early work included appearances on television shows, such as "The Phil Silvers Show" and "The Ed Sullivan Show." She also worked extensively in radio, providing voice-overs for commercials and narrations.

In the 1960s, Harris's career gained momentum, with notable roles in films like "The Producers" (1968) and "The Out-of-Towners" (1970). Her performances caught the attention of critics and audiences alike, solidifying her position as a talented character actress.

Throughout the 1970s and 1980s, Harris continued to work in film and television, appearing in a wide range of projects, including "Swingin' Summer" (1965), "Looking Up" (1977), and "Stand by Your Man" (1981). Her versatility as an actress allowed her to take on diverse roles, from comedy to drama, and she became a sought-after performer in the industry.

One of Harris's most iconic roles came in 1998, when she played the voice of Mrs. Potato Head in the animated film "Toy Story 2." This role marked a new chapter in her career, as she began to focus more on voice acting. She went on to reprise the role in several "Toy Story" sequels and spin-offs, becoming a beloved fixture in the franchise.

# Personal life and death

Estelle Harris was married to Sy Harris, a writer and producer, from 1952 until his death in 2011. The couple had two children together, a son named Glen and a daughter named Taryn. Harris was known to be a devoted mother and wife, and her family was incredibly important to her.

In her later years, Harris continued to work in the entertainment industry, albeit at a slower pace. She passed away on April 2, 2022, at the age of 93, just two days shy of her 94th birthday. article:
Andhra Pradesh
================

Andhra Pradesh is a state located in the southeastern region of India. It is the eighth largest state in India by area and the tenth most populous state in the country. The state is known for its rich cultural heritage, diverse geography, and significant economic growth. In this article, we will explore the various aspects of Andhra Pradesh, including its etymology, history, geography, demographics, culture, government, economy, infrastructure, and education.

Etymology
----------

The name "Andhra Pradesh" is derived from the Sanskrit words "Andhra" and "Pradesh". "Andhra" refers to the Andhra people, who were a group of Indo-Aryan tribes that inhabited the region in ancient times. "Pradesh" means "state" or "province". The name "Andhra Pradesh" was officially adopted in 1956, when the state was formed by merging the Telugu-speaking regions of the erstwhile states of Hyderabad and Madras.

History
-------

### Pre-history

The history of Andhra Pradesh dates back to the Stone Age. Archaeological findings have revealed that human habitation in the region existed as far back as 10,000 years ago. The region was inhabited by various tribes, including the Andhras, who were a group of Indo-Aryan tribes that migrated to the region from the north.

### Early and medieval history

The Andhra Pradesh region was a major center of trade and commerce in ancient India. The region was ruled by various dynasties, including the Satavahanas, the Pallavas, and the Chalukyas. During the medieval period, the region was ruled by the Kakatiya dynasty, who built the famous Warangal Fort.

### Modern history

In the 16th century, the region was conquered by the Mughal Empire, and later by the Nizam of Hyderabad. In 1947, India gained independence from British rule, and the region became part of the Indian Union. In 1956, the state of Andhra Pradesh was formed by merging the Telugu-speaking regions of the erstwhile states of Hyderabad and Madras.

Geography
----------

Andhra Pradesh is located in the southeastern region of India. The state is bordered by the states of Odisha to the north, Chhattisgarh to the northwest, Telangana to the west, and Tamil Nadu to the south. The state has a coastline of approximately 974 kilometers along the Bay of Bengal.

### Flora and fauna

Andhra Pradesh is home to a diverse range of flora and fauna. The state has several national parks and wildlife sanctuaries, including the Nagarjunsagar-Srisailam Tiger Reserve and the Pulicat Lake Bird Sanctuary.

### Mineral resources

Andhra Pradesh is rich in mineral resources, including coal, iron ore, limestone, and diamonds. The state is also a major producer of granite and marble.

### Climate

The climate of Andhra Pradesh is generally hot and humid. The state experiences a tropical wet and dry climate, with four distinct seasons: summer, monsoon, autumn, and winter. The state receives most of its rainfall during the monsoon season, which lasts from June to September.

Demographics
------------

Andhra Pradesh is the tenth most populous state in India, with a population of over 49 million people. The state has a population density of approximately 308 people per square kilometer.

### Religion

The majority of the population of Andhra Pradesh follows Hinduism, with a significant minority of Muslims and Christians.

### Sub categorization

The population of Andhra Pradesh can be sub-categorized into several groups, including:

* Telugu-speaking people: The majority of the population of Andhra Pradesh speaks Telugu, which is the official language of the state.
* Tribal communities: Andhra Pradesh is home to several tribal communities, including the Kondareddy, the Gond, and the Lambada.
* Dalits: The state has a significant population of Dalits, who are the lowest caste in the Indian caste system.

Culture
--------

Andhra Pradesh has a rich and diverse culture. The state is known for its traditional clothing, cuisine, literature, architecture, arts, and festivals.

### Clothing

The traditional clothing of Andhra Pradesh includes the dhoti and the sari. The dhoti is a long piece of cloth wrapped around the waist, while the sari is a long piece of cloth wrapped around the body.

### Cuisine

The cuisine of Andhra Pradesh is known for its spicy and tangy flavors. The state is famous for its biryani, which is a popular rice-based dish.

### Literature

Andhra Pradesh has a rich literary tradition. The state is home to several famous poets and writers, including Tirupati Venkata Kavulu and Gurajada Apparao.

### Architecture

The architecture of Andhra Pradesh is known for its temples and fortresses. The state is home to several famous temples, including the Tirumala Venkateswara Temple and the Srisailam Temple.

### Arts

Andhra Pradesh is known for its traditional arts, including music, dance, and theater. The state is home to several famous dance forms, including the Kuchipudi and the Bharatanatyam.

### Festivals

Andhra Pradesh celebrates several festivals throughout the year, including the Ugadi, the Sankranti, and the Diwali.

Government and administration
-----------------------------

Andhra Pradesh is a state in the Indian Union, with its own government and administration. The state has a unicameral legislature, with 175 members elected by the people.

### Cities and towns

Andhra Pradesh has several major cities and towns, including Visakhapatnam, Vijayawada, and Tirupati.

### Government revenue and expenditure

The government of Andhra Pradesh generates revenue from several sources, including taxes, grants, and loans. The state government spends its revenue on various sectors, including education, healthcare, and infrastructure.

Economy
-------

Andhra Pradesh has a diverse economy, with several major sectors, including agriculture, industries, and services.

### Agriculture

Agriculture is a major sector of the economy of Andhra Pradesh. The state is a significant producer of crops, including rice, sugarcane, and cotton.

### Industries

Andhra Pradesh has several major industries, including textiles, pharmaceuticals, and information technology.

### Services

The services sector is a significant contributor to the economy of Andhra Pradesh. The state has a major tourism industry, with several famous tourist destinations, including the Tirumala Venkateswara Temple and the Visakhapatnam Beach.

Infrastructure
--------------

Andhra Pradesh has a well-developed infrastructure, with several major roads, railways, airports, and seaports.

### Transport

#### Roads

Andhra Pradesh has a network of roads, including national highways, state highways, and district roads.

#### Railways

The state has a major railway network, with several major railway stations, including the Visakhapatnam Railway Station and the Vijayawada Railway Station.

#### Airports

Andhra Pradesh has several major airports, including the Visakhapatnam Airport and the Tirupati Airport.

#### Sea ports

The state has several major seaports, including the Visakhapatnam Port and the Kakinada Port.

### Communication

Andhra Pradesh has a well-developed communication network, with several major telephone exchanges and internet service providers.

### Water

The state has a major water supply system, with several major reservoirs and water treatment plants.

### Power

Andhra Pradesh has a major power generation and distribution system, with several major power plants and transmission lines.

### Healthcare

The state has a well-developed healthcare system, with several major hospitals and medical colleges.

### Banking

Andhra Pradesh has a well-developed banking system, with several major banks and financial institutions.

Education
----------

Andhra Pradesh has a well-developed education system, with several major universities and colleges.

Media
------

The state has a well-developed media system, with several major newspapers, television channels, and radio stations.

Sports
------

Andhra Pradesh has a major sports industry, with several famous sports personalities, including cricketers, footballers, and tennis players.

Donda 2
================

Donda 2 is the eleventh studio album by American rapper and producer Kanye West, released on February 22, 2022. The album is the sequel to West's 2021 album Donda and marks his first album released exclusively through his own Stem Player platform.

Background and recording
-------------------------

Donda 2 was recorded in the months following the release of its predecessor, with West working on new material in various locations, including Miami and Los Angeles. The album's production was handled by West himself, along with several other producers, including Mike Dean, Dem Jointz, and Digital Nas.

West has stated that the album was inspired by his personal life and experiences, including his divorce from Kim Kardashian and his struggles with mental health. He has also cited several influences on the album's sound, including gospel music, drill, and electronic dance music.

Music and themes
-----------------

Donda 2 is characterized by its experimental sound, which incorporates elements of various genres, including hip hop, electronic, and gospel music. The album features a mix of introspective and personal lyrics, as well as more aggressive and confrontational tracks.

One of the dominant themes on the album is West's relationship with his ex-wife Kim Kardashian and their children. Several tracks, including "True Love" and "City of Gods," address the couple's divorce and West's experiences as a co-parent.

The album also explores themes of mental health, addiction, and spirituality. West has stated that he was inspired by his own struggles with addiction and mental health issues, and several tracks on the album address these topics in a personal and introspective way.

The album was released exclusively through the Stem Player platform, which allows users to customize and remix the album's tracks. West has stated that he plans to release the album on other platforms in the future, but has not announced a specific release date.

Commercial performance

article:
Storm Eunice

Storm Eunice was a powerful and destructive European windstorm that affected many countries in Western and Central Europe in February 2022. The storm caused widespread damage, power outages, and loss of life, making it one of the most significant weather events of the year.

#Meteorology

Storm Eunice was a complex low-pressure system that developed over the North Atlantic Ocean on February 14, 2022. The storm rapidly intensified as it moved eastwards, driven by a strong jet stream and a contrast between cold Arctic air and mild air from the Gulf Stream. Eunice's central pressure dropped to around 960 mbar, making it a deep and powerful storm.

As Eunice approached the European coast, it began to undergo a process called "explosive cyclogenesis," where the storm's central pressure drops rapidly, leading to a significant increase in wind speed. This process resulted in hurricane-force winds, with gusts exceeding 150 km/h (93 mph) in some areas.

#Impact

The impact of Storm Eunice was felt across many countries in Western and Central Europe. The storm caused widespread damage, power outages, and loss of life, with the worst-affected areas being the UK, Ireland, and the Netherlands.

##Belgium

article:
Morbius is a 2022 American superhero film based on the Marvel Comics character of the same name. The film is directed by Daniel Espinosa and written by Matt Sazama and Burk Sharpless. It is the third film in Sony Pictures' Spider-Man Universe, following Venom (2018) and Venom: Let There Be Carnage (2021).

# Plot

The film follows Dr. Michael Morbius, a biochemist who suffers from a rare blood disorder. Desperate to cure his condition, Morbius experiments with a serum that combines human and vampire bat DNA. However, the serum has an unexpected side effect, transforming Morbius into a living vampire with superhuman strength, speed, and agility.

As Morbius struggles to control his newfound powers, he becomes embroiled in a conflict with a wealthy businessman named Milo Manfred, who suffers from the same blood disorder as Morbius. Manfred becomes obsessed with gaining the same powers as Morbius and will stop at nothing to acquire them.

# Cast

* Jared Leto as Dr. Michael Morbius
* Matt Smith as Milo Manfred
* Adria Arjona as Martine Bancroft
* Jared Harris as Dr. Emil Nicholas
* Al Madrigal as Alberto Rodriguez
* Tyrese Gibson as Simon Stroud

# Production

## Development

The development of Morbius began in 2017, when Sony Pictures announced plans to create a shared universe based on Marvel Comics characters. The studio hired Matt Sazama and Burk Sharpless to write the screenplay for Morbius, with Daniel Espinosa set to direct.

## Pre-production

Pre-production on Morbius began in 2020, with Jared Leto cast in the title role. The film's cast was rounded out with the additions of Matt Smith, Adria Arjona, Jared Harris, Al Madrigal, and Tyrese Gibson.

## Filming

Principal photography on Morbius began in February 2020 and wrapped in June 2020. The film was shot on location in London and Vancouver.

## Post-production

Post-production on Morbius began in July 2020 and was completed in March 2022. The film's visual effects were handled by Digital Domain, with a team led by visual effects supervisor, Eric Barba.

# Music

The score for Morbius was composed by Jon Ekstrand, who previously collaborated with Daniel Espinosa on the film, Life (2017).

# Marketing

The marketing campaign for Morbius began in January 2022, with the release of the film's first trailer. The trailer was met with a mixed response from fans and critics, with some praising the film's visuals and others expressing concern about the film's tone.

## Release

### Theatrical

Morbius was released in the United States on April 1, 2022, by Sony Pictures Releasing. The film was originally scheduled to be released on July 10, 2020, but was delayed due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

### Home media

Morbius was released on digital platforms on May 17, 2022, and on Blu-ray and DVD on June 14, 2022.

# Reception

## Box office

Morbius grossed $163 million worldwide, with $73 million of that coming from the United States. The film's box office performance was considered disappointing, given its estimated production budget of $75 million.

## Critical response

Morbius received mixed reviews from critics, with some praising the film's visuals and performances, while others criticized the film's tone and pacing. The film holds a 17% approval rating on Rotten Tomatoes, based on 222 reviews, with an average rating of 4.1/10.

## Internet memes

Morbius became a subject of internet memes, with many users poking fun at the film's poor box office performance and mixed critical reception. The film's trailer was also widely mocked, with many users creating parody videos and GIFs.

# Future

Despite the film's poor box office performance, Sony Pictures has expressed interest in developing a sequel to Morbius. The studio has also announced plans to develop a new Spider-Man Universe film, with the working title, "Madame Web".

# Notes

Morbius is the third film in Sony Pictures' Spider-Man Universe, following Venom (2018) and Venom: Let There Be Carnage (2021). The film is also the first to feature a character from the Spider-Man comics who is not a superhero.
